bibl.title: Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiuro v. United States. Writ.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

div1.p: In the District Court of the United States, For the Western District of Washington, Northern Division
In the matter of the Petition of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiura, alias B.K. Sugiura, aliens, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus | #2628 Writ of Habeas Corpus
The President of The United States of America, to Henry M. White, Comissioner of Immigration of the United States, Greeting:

We command you that you have the bodies of Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Saugiura, alias B.K. Sugiura, aliens, by you imprisioned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of said imprisionment and detention, by whatsoever name said Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiura, alias B.K. Sugiura, may be called or charged, before Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the District Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, at the Court Room of said Court in the City of Seattle, County of King, State of Washington, on the 16th day of December, A.D. 1913, at 10 o'clock in the forenoon of that day to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Albert H. Young and Kamasaburo Sugiura, alias B.K. Sugiura. And have you then and there this writ.
Witness the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of said District Court of the United States, for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, this 12th day of December, A.D. 1913
Attest, my hand and the seal of the said Court, the day and year last above written.
div1.ab: By Ed M Larken Deputy Clerk
